title: Galatians Chapter 1 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Galatians chapter 1 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Galatians Chapter 1 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Galatians Chapter 1.

questions.question: According to Galatians 1:1, by whom was Paul appointed as an apostle?
options: Jesus Christ and God the Father
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ and God the Father
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:1 states that Paul was an apostle 'not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead.'

questions.question: To whom did Paul address the letter in Galatians 1:2?
questions.correctAnswer: The churches of Galatia
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:2 says Paul wrote 'unto the churches of Galatia.'

questions.question: What does Paul wish for the Galatians in Galatians 1:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Grace and peace
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:3 states, 'Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ.'

questions.question: According to Galatians 1:4, why did Jesus give Himself?
options: To deliver us from this present evil world
questions.correctAnswer: To deliver us from this present evil world
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:4 says Jesus gave Himself 'that he might deliver us from this present evil world.'

questions.question: What is Paul amazed at according to Galatians 1:6?
options: That the Galatians are so quickly deserting the gospel
That the Galatians have great faith
That the Galatians have received the law
questions.correctAnswer: That the Galatians are so quickly deserting the gospel
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:6 states, 'I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel.'

questions.question: Who does Paul say should be accursed if they preach a different gospel in Galatians 1:8?
questions.correctAnswer: Even an angel from heaven
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:8 says, 'But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.'

questions.question: According to Galatians 1:10, whom does Paul seek to please?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:10 says Paul does not seek to please men but God, stating, 'for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.'

questions.question: How did Paul receive the gospel according to Galatians 1:12?
options: By the revelation of Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: By the revelation of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:12 states, 'For I neither received it of man, neither was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.'

questions.question: Before his conversion, what was Paul known for according to Galatians 1:13?
questions.correctAnswer: Persecuting the church of God
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:13 says Paul 'beyond measure persecuted the church of God, and wasted it.'

questions.question: Where did Paul go immediately after his conversion according to Galatians 1:17?
questions.correctAnswer: Arabia
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:17 states that Paul 'went into Arabia, and returned again unto Damascus' after his conversion.

questions.question: How long did Paul stay with Peter in Jerusalem according to Galatians 1:18?
questions.correctAnswer: Fifteen days
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:18 says Paul 'abode with him fifteen days.'

questions.question: True or False: Paul saw many apostles in Jerusalem when he visited according to Galatians 1:19.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:19 states, 'But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord's brother,' indicating Paul saw only one apostle.

questions.question: True or False: Paul was well known to the churches of Judaea when he visited according to Galatians 1:22.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:22 says Paul 'was unknown by face unto the churches of Judaea which were in Christ.'

questions.question: True or False: The churches glorified God because Paul preached the faith he once destroyed according to Galatians 1:24.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:24 states, 'And they glorified God in me,' because Paul now preached the faith he once persecuted.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Galatians 1:15: 'But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother's ______, and called me by his grace,'
questions.correctAnswer: womb
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:15 says, 'But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother's womb, and called me by his grace,'

medium.title: Galatians Chapter 1 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Galatians Chapter 1 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with remaining faithful despite pressure to follow false teachings. Based on Galatians 1, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Stay firm in the gospel you received, as any other gospel is accursed.
Change your beliefs to please others for peace.
Ignore the gospel and focus on personal opinions.
Accept all teachings if they sound reasonable.
questions.correctAnswer: Stay firm in the gospel you received, as any other gospel is accursed.
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:6-9 emphasizes the importance of holding to the true gospel and warns against accepting any other gospel, even if preached by angels, declaring them accursed.

questions.question: How does Galatians 1 teach about the source of true gospel teaching?
options: It comes by revelation from Jesus Christ, not from man.
It is passed down only through tradition.
It is based on human wisdom and learning.
questions.correctAnswer: It comes by revelation from Jesus Christ, not from man.
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:11-12 states that Paul's gospel was received not from man nor taught by man, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ, highlighting divine origin.

questions.question: A believer feels discouraged about past mistakes. What truth from Paul's testimony in Galatians 1 would encourage them?
options: God's grace can call and transform even those who persecuted the church.
Past sins disqualify you from serving God.
Only perfect people are called by God.
Your past defines your spiritual value.
questions.correctAnswer: God's grace can call and transform even those who persecuted the church.
questions.explanation: In Galatians 1:13-16, Paul shares how God called him by grace despite his past persecution of the church, showing God's power to redeem and transform.

questions.question: What does Galatians 1 teach about seeking to please men versus serving Christ?
options: Serving Christ means not seeking to please men.
Pleasing men is the highest goal in ministry.
One should always prioritize human approval.
Serving Christ and pleasing men are the same.
questions.correctAnswer: Serving Christ means not seeking to please men.
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:10 teaches that seeking to please men is incompatible with being a servant of Christ, emphasizing obedience to God over people.

questions.question: How does Galatians 1 encourage believers to handle false teachings in the church?
options: Reject any gospel that differs from the true gospel.
Accept all teachings to avoid conflict.
Ignore false teachings and focus on personal faith.
Blend different teachings to create harmony.
questions.correctAnswer: Reject any gospel that differs from the true gospel.
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:8-9 instruct believers to reject any other gospel than the one originally preached, even if it comes from angels or apostles.

questions.question: What spiritual discipline is modeled by Paul in Galatians 1 regarding receiving and sharing the gospel?
options: Relying on personal revelation and obedience without immediate consultation.
Seeking approval from church leaders before acting.
Delaying action until fully trained by others.
questions.correctAnswer: Relying on personal revelation and obedience without immediate consultation.
questions.explanation: Paul describes in Galatians 1:16-17 how he did not consult flesh and blood immediately but obeyed the revelation and called to preach, modeling personal devotion and obedience.

questions.question: A new believer wants to know how to maintain humility in ministry. What example from Galatians 1 could you share?
options: Paul did not boast of human approval but acknowledged God's calling.
Paul sought to gain popularity among men.
Paul depended on his own wisdom to preach.
Paul elevated himself above other apostles.
questions.correctAnswer: Paul did not boast of human approval but acknowledged God's calling.
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:10-12 shows Paul emphasizing that his apostleship and gospel came from God, not men, teaching humility and reliance on God's authority.

questions.question: How does Galatians 1 address the importance of integrity and honesty in proclaiming the gospel?
options: Paul solemnly affirms he is not lying before God about his gospel message.
Paul admits to changing his message to suit listeners.
Paul hides his past to appear better.
Paul relies on clever speech to convince others.
questions.correctAnswer: Paul solemnly affirms he is not lying before God about his gospel message.
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:20 emphasizes Paul's honesty and integrity by declaring that he does not lie before God regarding what he teaches.

questions.question: A church member is facing temptation to abandon the gospel for easier teachings. Based on Galatians 1, what counsel would you give?
options: Remain steadfast in the true gospel and reject any other teaching.
Adapt your beliefs to fit your circumstances.
Follow popular opinion to avoid hardship.
Ignore teachings and rely solely on feelings.
questions.correctAnswer: Remain steadfast in the true gospel and reject any other teaching.
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:6-9 warns against turning to a different gospel and calls believers to remain in the grace of Christ.

questions.question: How does Galatians 1 encourage believers to view their calling and purpose in life?
options: Recognize that God calls and separates individuals by grace for His purposes.
Believe that calling depends on human effort alone.
Assume your purpose is defined by worldly success.
Ignore spiritual callings and focus on personal desires.
questions.correctAnswer: Recognize that God calls and separates individuals by grace for His purposes.
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:15-16 shows that God separated Paul from his mother's womb and called him by grace to reveal His Son, indicating divine purpose in calling.

questions.question: True or False: According to Galatians 1, Paul consulted with the Jerusalem apostles immediately after his conversion.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:17 states Paul did not immediately consult with the apostles in Jerusalem but went into Arabia and then returned to Damascus.

questions.question: True or False: The churches in Judea initially rejected Paul after his conversion because of his past persecution of Christians.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:23-24 explains that the churches had only heard that Paul who persecuted them now preached the faith and they glorified God in him, indicating acceptance.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Paul says he was called by God's grace to ________ His Son among the heathen.
questions.correctAnswer: preach
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:16 reveals Paul was called to preach Jesus among the heathen, demonstrating obedience to God's calling.

questions.question: According to Galatians 1, how should believers respond to those who pervert the gospel?
options: Ignore their teachings and remain silent.
Try to blend their ideas with the gospel.
questions.correctAnswer: Reject and consider them accursed.
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:7-9 warns that those who pervert the gospel should be rejected and labeled accursed to protect the purity of the gospel.

questions.question: How does Galatians 1 teach about the role of gratitude in the life of a believer?
options: The churches glorified God for Paul's transformation, showing gratitude for God's work.
Gratitude is optional and unrelated to faith.
Gratitude should be shown only to people.
questions.correctAnswer: The churches glorified God for Paul's transformation, showing gratitude for God's work.
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:24 describes how the churches glorified God in Paul, reflecting gratitude for God's grace and transformation.

hard.title: Galatians Chapter 1 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Galatians Chapter 1.

questions.question: According to Galatians 1:1, by what authority does Paul call himself an apostle?
options: Not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ and God the Father
By the approval of the Jerusalem council
By the tradition of the elders
By the will of the Galatian churches
questions.correctAnswer: Not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ and God the Father
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:1 states Paul’s apostleship is not from human authority but directly from Jesus Christ and God the Father who raised Him from the dead, emphasizing divine commissioning.

questions.question: In the greeting of Galatians 1:3, from whom does Paul say grace and peace come?
options: God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:3 specifically mentions grace and peace coming from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ, establishing the divine source of blessings.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Christ giving Himself according to Galatians 1:4?
options: To deliver us from this present evil world
To establish a new political kingdom
To fulfill the Law of Moses
To lead a rebellion against Rome
questions.correctAnswer: To deliver us from this present evil world
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:4 explains that Christ gave Himself for our sins to rescue us from the present evil world, highlighting the spiritual deliverance fulfilled according to God’s will.

questions.question: What is Paul’s reaction to the Galatians turning to a different gospel in Galatians 1:6?
options: He marvels that they are so soon removed from him who called them
He rejoices in their new understanding
He remains silent to avoid conflict
He sends another apostle to teach them
questions.correctAnswer: He marvels that they are so soon removed from him who called them
questions.explanation: In Galatians 1:6, Paul expresses astonishment that the Galatians quickly desert the grace of Christ for a different gospel, showing his concern for doctrinal purity.

questions.question: In Galatians 1:8-9, Paul uses a strong warning about preaching another gospel. What is the consequence he pronounces?
questions.correctAnswer: Let him be accursed
questions.explanation: Paul emphatically states in verses 8 and 9 that anyone preaching a gospel other than the one he preached should be accursed, underscoring the seriousness of gospel integrity.

questions.question: What does Paul claim as his motivation in Galatians 1:10 when he asks if he seeks to please men or God?
options: He seeks to please God and be the servant of Christ
He seeks to gain popularity among the Jews
He desires to conform to Roman law
He aims to amass wealth and power
questions.correctAnswer: He seeks to please God and be the servant of Christ
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:10 reveals Paul’s primary motivation is to please God, not men, affirming his commitment to Christ’s service over human approval.

questions.question: How did Paul receive the gospel he preached, according to Galatians 1:12?
options: By the revelation of Jesus Christ
Through the teachings of the Pharisees
By studying the Old Testament scriptures
questions.correctAnswer: By the revelation of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Paul states in Galatians 1:12 that his gospel was not taught by man but received directly through a revelation from Jesus Christ, emphasizing divine origin.

questions.question: Before his conversion, how does Paul describe his past behavior toward the church in Galatians 1:13?
options: He persecuted the church of God beyond measure
He was a devoted follower of Jesus
He was indifferent to religious matters
He was a leader in the early Christian community
questions.correctAnswer: He persecuted the church of God beyond measure
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:13 describes Paul’s zealous persecution of the church before his conversion, setting up a dramatic contrast with his apostolic mission.

questions.question: What does Paul say about his zeal for the traditions of his fathers in Galatians 1:14?
options: He was more exceedingly zealous than many of his equals
He was indifferent to Jewish customs
He only followed the traditions partially
questions.correctAnswer: He was more exceedingly zealous than many of his equals
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:14 highlights Paul’s intense zeal for Jewish traditions, exceeding that of many in his nation, illustrating his former religious fervor.

questions.question: According to Galatians 1:15-16, what was God's purpose in calling Paul by grace?
options: To reveal His Son in Paul so he might preach to the Gentiles
To make Paul a leader in the synagogue
To enable Paul to become a political ruler
To help Paul write the Old Testament
questions.correctAnswer: To reveal His Son in Paul so he might preach to the Gentiles
questions.explanation: Verses 15-16 explain God’s calling was to reveal Jesus in Paul for the purpose of preaching to the heathen, indicating the missionary focus of his apostleship.

questions.question: Where did Paul go immediately after his revelation and before meeting the apostles, as stated in Galatians 1:17?
questions.correctAnswer: Arabia
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:17 shows that Paul did not immediately consult with the apostles but went into Arabia, indicating a period of preparation or reflection.

questions.question: How long did Paul stay with Peter when he visited Jerusalem after three years, according to Galatians 1:18?
questions.correctAnswer: Fifteen days
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:18 specifies Paul’s visit to Peter lasted fifteen days, a brief but significant meeting for apostolic recognition.

questions.question: Which brother of the Lord did Paul see during his visit to Jerusalem, according to Galatians 1:19?
questions.correctAnswer: James
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:19 mentions James, the Lord’s brother, as the only other apostle Paul saw during that visit, highlighting James’s leadership in the Jerusalem church.

questions.question: True or False: According to Galatians 1:22, the churches of Judea were well acquainted with Paul by face before his conversion.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:22 states Paul was unknown by face to the churches of Judea that were in Christ, showing his limited personal contact initially.

questions.question: How did the churches of Judea respond when they heard of Paul’s conversion and preaching, according to Galatians 1:23-24?
questions.correctAnswer: They glorified God in him
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:23-24 explains that although they had only heard of Paul’s conversion, the churches glorified God because of the transformation and preaching of faith.

theological.title: Galatians Chapter 1 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Galatians Chapter 1 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Galatians 1:1, by whom was Paul appointed an apostle?
options: Jesus Christ and God the Father
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ and God the Father
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:1 states Paul was an apostle not appointed by men but by Jesus Christ and God the Father who raised Him from the dead, affirming divine commissioning rather than human ordination, consistent with Acts 9:15 and Romans 1:1.

questions.question: What greeting does Paul extend to the Galatians in Galatians 1:3?
options: Grace and peace from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ
Blessings and prosperity from the Holy Spirit
Joy and hope from the apostles
Faith and love from the church
questions.correctAnswer: Grace and peace from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: In Galatians 1:3, Paul greets with grace and peace from God the Father and Jesus Christ, a common Pauline benediction emphasizing divine favor and reconciliation, paralleling Romans 1:7 and Philippians 1:2.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Christ giving Himself according to Galatians 1:4?
options: To deliver us from this present evil world
To establish a new kingdom on earth
questions.correctAnswer: To deliver us from this present evil world
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:4 teaches Christ gave Himself for our sins to deliver us from the present evil world, indicating salvation from sin and worldly corruption, consistent with John 12:31 and Colossians 1:13.

questions.question: In Galatians 1:6, Paul expresses astonishment because the Galatians have turned to what?
questions.correctAnswer: Another gospel
questions.explanation: Paul marvels in Galatians 1:6 that the Galatians quickly turned to another gospel, indicating a deviation from true Christian doctrine, highlighting the danger of false teaching as also warned in 2 Corinthians 11:4.

questions.question: What warning does Paul give about those preaching a different gospel in Galatians 1:8?
questions.correctAnswer: Let them be accursed
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:8 states that anyone preaching a gospel different from the original should be accursed, emphasizing the seriousness of doctrinal purity, consistent with Deuteronomy 13:1-5 and 2 John 1:9.

questions.question: According to Galatians 1:10, what is Paul NOT seeking to please?
questions.correctAnswer: Men
questions.explanation: Paul declares in Galatians 1:10 that he does not seek to please men but God, affirming his commitment to divine approval over human popularity, as echoed in 1 Thessalonians 2:4 and Colossians 3:23.

questions.question: How did Paul receive the gospel he preached according to Galatians 1:12?
questions.correctAnswer: By revelation of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:12 says Paul received the gospel not from man but by the revelation of Jesus Christ, indicating a direct divine source, aligning with Acts 26:16-18 and 2 Corinthians 12:1-7.

questions.question: Before his conversion, what was Paul known for in relation to the church according to Galatians 1:13?
options: Persecuting and wasting the church of God
questions.correctAnswer: Persecuting and wasting the church of God
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:13 describes Paul's former life as one who persecuted the church beyond measure, consistent with Acts 8:3 and Philippians 3:6, illustrating radical transformation.

questions.question: What does Galatians 1:14 say about Paul's zeal before conversion?
options: He was more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of his fathers
He was indifferent to religious customs
questions.correctAnswer: He was more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of his fathers
questions.explanation: Paul states in Galatians 1:14 that he was exceedingly zealous for his ancestral traditions, highlighting his intense commitment to Judaism before conversion, parallel to Acts 22:3 and Philippians 3:5.

questions.question: According to Galatians 1:15, who separated Paul from his mother’s womb and called him by grace?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:15 declares that God separated Paul from his mother's womb and called him by grace, emphasizing divine sovereignty in election, consistent with Jeremiah 1:5 and Romans 9:11-16.

questions.question: What was revealed to Paul in order that he might preach among the Gentiles according to Galatians 1:16?
questions.correctAnswer: His Son
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:16 states God revealed His Son in Paul so that he might preach Him among the Gentiles, affirming Christocentric mission, aligned with Acts 9:20 and Romans 15:16.

questions.question: After his revelation, where did Paul go before visiting the apostles in Jerusalem as stated in Galatians 1:17?
questions.correctAnswer: Arabia
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:17 records Paul going into Arabia and then returning to Damascus before visiting Jerusalem, indicating a period of preparation and revelation, consistent with Acts 9:19-25.

questions.question: How long did Paul stay with Peter in Jerusalem according to Galatians 1:18?
questions.correctAnswer: Fifteen days
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:18 specifies Paul stayed fifteen days with Peter, showing brief but significant fellowship, corroborated by Acts 9:26-30.

questions.question: Who among the apostles did Paul see besides Peter in Jerusalem as mentioned in Galatians 1:19?
questions.correctAnswer: James the Lord's brother
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:19 states Paul saw no other apostles except James, the Lord’s brother, highlighting James' leadership in the Jerusalem church, consistent with Acts 15:13-21.

questions.question: How did the churches of Judea regard Paul after his conversion according to Galatians 1:23?
options: They had heard he persecuted them but now preached the faith
questions.correctAnswer: They had heard he persecuted them but now preached the faith
questions.explanation: Galatians 1:23 explains the Judean churches heard that Paul who once persecuted the church now preached the faith he once destroyed, highlighting God’s transformative power, consistent with Acts 9:20-22.
